sentence.Network_en: Bureaucracy may be said as a disease in our very vitals.
sentence.Network_cn: 官僚主义可说是我们的心腹之患.

sentence.Network_en: The disease has attacked the vitals -- beyond cure .

list.abs: 肺_百度百科 ... 肺腑[ the buttom of one's heart] 肺活量[ vital capacity] 肺结核[ pulmonary tuberculosis].
【摘要】:正活体染色(vital staining)一般是指用无毒或毒性很小的染料,在不影响细胞的正常生命活动的前提下而使活细胞的某些结构着色的一种实验方法。最早进行.

means.word_mean: 1. a bodily organ that is essential for life

auth_sentence.content: Would'st thou have me turn Pelican, and feed thee out of my own Vitals?

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Would'st thou have me turn Pelican, and feed thee out of my own Vitals?

auth_sentence.content: She wrote in her diary that he was not a big eater and that down there, his vitals were missing.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 生死攸关的,重大的;有活力的;生命的,生机的
stems_affixes.word_buile: vit生命+al……的→adj.生死攸关的,重大的;有活力的;生命的,生机的
vital有活力的+ism学术流派→n.活机论, 生机说
vital[adj.生死攸关的,重大的;有活力的;生命的,生机的]+ity表名词→n.活力,生命力;生机,元气

stems_affixes.value_cn: 主要部件;[人体的]重要器官
stems_affixes.word_buile: vital有活力的+s→有活力的东西

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使复活,使重新充满活力
